coverage_overview: Your motor insurance policy is a Comprehensive policy that covers both third-party liability and own damage. It includes optional add-ons depending on your plan.
standard_features: Own-damage coverage for accidental physical damage
Personal accident cover for owner-driver (up to policy limit)
Legal liability to paid driver and passengers (as per policy limits)

common_addons.name: Bumper-to-Bumper (Zero Depreciation)
common_addons.description: Covers the full cost of replaced parts without depreciation deduction for the insured vehicle's age, typically excludes rubber/consumable parts.
common_addons.benefit: Higher claim payout for part replacement; reduces customer out-of-pocket on claims.

common_addons.name: Roadside Assistance (24x7)
common_addons.description: Provides towing, on-spot repairs, fuel assistance, and minor part replacement for breakdowns or flat tyre.
common_addons.benefit: Convenience and reduced downtime after a breakdown.

common_addons.name: Engine Protection Cover
common_addons.description: Covers mechanical/engine damage due to oil leakage, water ingestion, and other internal engine failures (subject to T&Cs).
common_addons.benefit: Protects against expensive engine repairs not covered under standard OD.

common_addons.name: Personal Accident (Enhanced)
common_addons.description: Enhanced PA cover that increases the sum insured for the driver and co-passengers beyond statutory minima.
common_addons.benefit: Higher payout for injury or death resulting from an accident.

common_addons.name: Nil Depreciation (selected parts)
common_addons.description: No depreciation applied to certain replaced parts like bumpers, headlights and tail-lights.
common_addons.benefit: Reduces the customer's repair bill for common part replacements.

common_addons.name: NCB Protect
common_addons.description: Protects No-Claim Bonus in case of 1 claim within the policy period (subject to policy terms).
common_addons.benefit: Avoids loss of NCB for small claims.

claim_process_steps: Step 1 — Immediate Action: Seek safety first. In case of injury, call emergency services.
Step 2 — Inform Insurer: Notify the insurer or log an FNOL within 24 hours via the app/portal or customer service.
Step 3 — Document: Click photos of damage, collect police report (if required), and gather witnesses' details.
Step 4 — Assessment: Insurer assigns an assessor or authorized workshop for damage evaluation.
Step 5 — Repair / Settlement: After acceptance, repair is authorized at network workshop or cash settlement is processed.
required_documents: Police FIR (for theft/accident with third-party injury as required)
Estimate from the repair workshop (if available)
sop_notes: Coverage subject to policy terms, exclusions, waiting periods for add-ons, and territorial limits. Always consult the policy schedule for exact sums insured and deductibles.
